item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Homemade polarimetric synthetic aperture radar drone (175 points | 15 comments)
2. Uchū – Color scheme for internet lovers (369 points | 152 comments)
3. “A calculator app? Anyone could make that” (1374 points | 347 comments)
4. San Francisco homelessness: Park ranger helps one person at a time (130 points | 168 comments)
5. Word embeddings – Part 3: The secret ingredients of Word2Vec (5 points | discuss)
6. Anno 1800: Shadows of Beauty (38 points | 1 comment)
7. All Kindles can now be jailbroken (215 points | 82 comments)
8. Does or did COBOL default to 1875-05-20 for corrupt or missing dates? (88 points | 119 comments)
9. I pulled data on 1378 restaurants from Google Maps to rank them in order (21 points | 3 comments)
10. Show HN: Air traffic control radio and chill music for focus (140 points | 77 comments)
11. Opposing arrows of time can theoretically emerge from certain quantum systems (56 points | 55 comments)
12. Flea-Scope: $18 Source Available USB Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer and More [pdf] (274 points | 92 comments)
13. MySQL at Uber (44 points | 11 comments)
14. Extreme supersonic winds measured on a planet outside our solar system (22 points | 5 comments)
15. IPv6 Is Hard (150 points | 232 comments)
16. Ugandan runner Jacob Kiplimo completes first ever sub-57 minute half marathon (63 points | 17 comments)
17. How do modern compilers choose which variables to put in registers? (17 points | discuss)
18. YouTube asks channel owner to verify phone, permanently overwrites personal info (150 points | 111 comments)
19. Javier Milei backtracks on $4.4B memecoin after 'insiders' pocket $87M (132 points | 142 comments)
20. Explaining my fast 6502 code generator (2023) (75 points | 14 comments)
21. Gold Is Worth More in New York (63 points | 59 comments)
22. Publish Your Gaussian Splats with SuperSplat (30 points | 3 comments)
23. When Not to Obey Orders (2019) (56 points | 10 comments)
24. Physics Informed Neural Networks (24 points | 1 comment)
25. Half-Life 2 and Dishonored art lead Viktor Antonov has died (433 points | 86 comments)
26. OpenVINO AI effects [denoising and transcription] for Audacity (121 points | 24 comments)
27. Did the Windows 95 setup team forget that MS-DOS can do graphics? (65 points | 23 comments)
28. United States Power Outage Map (268 points | 128 comments)
29. Root-inspired additive printing for fabricating robust conformal electronics (17 points | 1 comment)
30. Oklch in CSS: why we moved from RGB and HSL (2024) (52 points | 16 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
